poem:
Title: The Semblance of Ubuntu 

Perchance till two-thousand-four-score,
The once homed by the Gaza shore,
Shall trade rubble for abode once more.
Quarry of conflict, kinship ignored,
Cost of brick, of mortar, of accord,
Soaring to numbers we ill afford.
Yet in every stone, a lifeline cast,
A future molded from the past,
And thus, the world is home at last.
